meanings.definition: Covered with or consisting of scales.
meanings.sent1: The lizard's skin had a rough scaliness to it.
meanings.sent2: The fish had a shiny scaliness that glimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The scaliness of the dragon's skin made it look like a mythical creature.
meanings.sent4: The scaliness of the old building's paint gave it a weathered appearance.
meanings.sent5: The scaliness of the tree bark resembled a pattern of tiny shields.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being scaly.
meanings.sent1: The scaliness of the snake's skin helped it blend into its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The dermatologist examined the patient's skin for any signs of scaliness.
meanings.sent3: The scaliness of the pastry crust added a delightful crunch to the dessert.
meanings.sent4: The scaliness of the map indicated the different terrain types.
meanings.sent5: The scaliness of the rock surface made it difficult to climb.
